page.title: 03UNEMPLOYMENT - HEDNESFORD
page.content: During the 1980s, unemployment has risen and the total number of unemployed now stands at 3.5 million. Many school leavers in this area face a grim future. Much of the traditional industry has declined or disappeared altogether. However due to the Youth Training Schemes set up by the government the percentage of unemployed school leavers from my school has decreased. From 1981/84 the percentage of those going into permanent employment has decreased from 18% to 8%. Yet the number of unemployed has also decreased from 13% to 7%. This reduction has been caused by the increase in the number of those entering Training Schemes which has increased from 27% to 45%.
